title: Net Asset Value(s)
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Mon, Oct 5, 2015, 17:23 BST - UK Markets closed US stocks move higher; energy, GE, Twitter are among gainers US stocks rise as energy companies climb along with price of oil; General Electric, Twitter up By Ken Sweet, AP Business Writer | Associated Press – 22 minutes ago View Photo 
Stock traders work at the New York Stock Exchange, Monday, Oct. 5, 2015 in New York. World stocks rose … 
NEW YORK (AP) -- U.S. stocks are rising in midday trading, led by gains in the energy sector as the price of oil turns higher. 
General Electric jumped 4 percent Monday after activist investor Nelson Pelts bought a stake in the company. 
Twitter rose 5 percent after a long-running search for a full-time CEO concluded. Co-founder Jack Dorsey will have a second chance at leading the company. 
The Dow Jones industrial average gained 188 points, or 1.1 percent, to 16,662 as of 11:45 a.m. Eastern time. 
The Standard & Poor's 500 index rose 23 points, or 1.2 percent, to 1,975. The Nasdaq composite rose 45 points, or 1 percent, to 4,753. 
Oil rose 2 percent to $46.70 a barrel in New York. 
Bond prices fell. The yield on the 10-year Treasury note rose to 2.02 percent.
